questionsData.title: Alkalis corrode metals and rocks.
More heat makes the particles of water travel apart.
The back of the bowl makes images look bigger.
Sound range from very low to very high.
Doctors first treat the illness before diagnosing it.
Solar eclipse occur when the moon passes between the earth and the sun.
Balls are made of rubber.
Tigers are pets that live in houses.
You can find a stream between two rivers.
Prefixes come before the stem of the word.
In famine people die of hunger.
Storm and wind are antonyms.
Richter scale measures the strength of earthquakes.
Run and manage have different meanings.
questionsData.explain_answer:
False.
In some contexts, "run" and "manage" can have similar meanings, especially when referring to being in charge of something like a business or office. 

  • Run: When used in the sense of "run an office" or "run a business," it means to be responsible for the day-to-day operations, overseeing how things function.
  • Manage: "Manage an office" means to control, organize, and oversee the office's operations, making decisions to ensure things run smoothly.
     

    في بعض السياقات، يمكن أن يكون لـ"run" و"manage" معانٍ متشابهة، خاصة عند الإشارة إلى كون الشخص مسؤولاً عن شيء مثل إدارة عمل أو مكتب.

  • Run: عندما تُستخدم في سياق "يدير مكتب" أو "يدير عمل"، فإنها تعني أن الشخص مسؤول عن العمليات اليومية، والإشراف على كيفية سير الأمور.

  • Manage: "إدارة مكتب" تعني التحكم في العمليات، وتنظيمها، والإشراف عليها، واتخاذ القرارات لضمان سير الأمور بسلاسة.

questionsData.title: Newsreader is someone who writes the news.
Adults and children are synonyms.
A suffix always changes the part of speech of the word.
"Stuffing" means "to take out from it".
questionsData.explain_answer: The term "stuffing" means to fill something , not taking something out from it.

questionsData.title: To pick something up is to raise it up.
Pirates are good people who used to help a lot.
The text is mainly talking about .....................
questionsData.article: Revolution is the journey of the Earth around the Sun (which 3) takes 365 days and 6 hours to complete. During this revolution, the Earth’s axis of rotation is tilted about 23 in relation to its path around the Sun.This almost circular path is called an orbit. This revolution and tilt causes the change of seasons as well as change in the length of the days and nights. In the northern hemisphere, the summer solstice starts on 21st June which is the (longest 2) day of the year. Fall starts on 21st September and this is the fall equinox when day and night are of equal length. Winter (starts 1) on 21st December and this is the winter solstice and the shortest day of the year. Spring starts on 21st March and this is the spring equinox when day and night are of equal length. In the southern hemisphere, the dates of equinoxes and solstices are reversed, so it is winter in the northern hemisphere.

questionsData.title: ..........most books are made of paper.
......... is a compound word.
Anwar has a spare key. The word "spare" is a/ an .......
The prefix ......changes the word "polite" into negative.
The colder the weather, the......clothes we wear.
The Red sea is not the same ......as the Mediterranean sea.
Yemenis are famous ...... their hospitality.
The man...... I met yesterday was an old friend.
The lecture was supposed to start early, ...... it didn't.
We have neighbors next door. They are always ......
questionsData.explain_answer:
We have neighbors next door. They are always  noisy .

Noisy is an adjective that describes the neighbors themselves and their tendency to make a lot of noise.

  • Noisiness is a noun, and it wouldn't grammatically fit in this sentence where you need an adjective.
  • Noise is also a noun, referring to the sound itself.
  • Noisily is an adverb, and it would describe how they make noise, but the sentence is more focused on the general characteristic of the neighbors.

questionsData.title: Rice does not ...... in cold climate.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Here's why:

-Grew is the past tense of the verb "grow" and is used to talk about something that happened in the past (e.g., The rice grew well last summer).
-Grown is the past participle of "grow" and is used with helping verbs like "has" or "have" to form the perfect tenses (e.g., The rice has already been grown).
-Grows is the present tense, third-person singular form of "grow" and is used to talk about something that happens habitually or generally (e.g., The rice grows best in warm climates).
-In this sentence, we are talking about a general fact - rice does not typically grow in cold climates. So, we need the present tense verb form to indicate this habitual characteristic.
